Hello World! I'm Nishanth Prakash, a masters student studying Computer Science at Brown University (expected to graduate in May, 2018). I obtained my undergraduate degree in Computer Engineering from National Institute of Technology Karnataka, Surathkal. I'm originally from Bangalore, India.
I have developed, over the last few years an abiding interest in exploring the symmetry that "miraculously" exists between mathematics and nature. This has naturally led to me to delve into areas related to Machine Learning, Reinforcement Learning, AI and Computer Science Theory in general.
I have also developed a penchant for programming; I believe it is where the mathematical symmetries are at action, and alive! I have had the opportunity to develop software for a variety of different domains including Databases (HPE - Vertica), Compilers and Program Analyzers (Aspiring Minds), Machine Learning -- Computer Vision, Natural Language Processing (India Innovation Labs, Aspiring Minds).
The above interests have also in turn led me to explore ideas at the intersection of Machine Learning and Software Engineering such as Automated Analysis of Software Design and Software Synthesis.
Lastly, but most importantly, I'm interested in playing a part in the understanding and deconstruction of human intelligence and cognition in terms of mathematical constructs. I believe that this not only enables the understanding of the biological process of learning but also reciprocally helps build biologically inspired artificial intelligent agents that can augment human abilities, overcome disabilities, improve human learning and cognition (resulting in effective education) and assist in the everlasting human enterprise of understanding the world.
Causes I care deeply about:
Design and development of intelligent assistive technologies for the functionally disabled
Building sustainable platforms for decentralized ownership of data and Artificial Intelligence
Computer Science Education
